intro: Euphrasia pectinata var. valdesetulosa, commonly known as the Valdesetulosa eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, hairy structures, while its stems are erect and branching. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive, dainty appearance.
